main_definition: Acquisitions refer to the process of obtaining or purchasing assets, such as companies, properties, or equipment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In business context, referring to the purchase and integration of other companies into a larger corporation
meanings_and_examples.example: The tech giant recently completed several major acquisitions by purchasing smaller startups.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of acquiring physical assets or property through legal means
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of saving, John was able to make his first big real estate acquisition: a beautiful townhouse.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In education and research institutions, referring to the process of adding new libraries, books, journals or other resources to their collections
meanings_and_examples.example: The university's library made significant acquisitions in recent years by purchasing rare manuscripts and first editions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In biology, referring to the process of acquiring nutrients or genetic material from the environment
meanings_and_examples.example: Bacteria can acquire antibiotic resistance through horizontal gene transfer.
